page.title: 13YATELEY INDUSTRIES
page.content: Yateley Industries provides sheltered housing and workshops for disabled women.It was started by Jessie Brown and Grace Finch.In 1937 a hostel and workshop for 8 physically handicapped girls was opened.It was closed but was re-opened in 1946.In 1952 with the Nuffield Trust and Goverment aid the present substantial workshop was constructed and specially designed bungalows followed.Here up to 60 girls design and print fabrics which are made into bags,aprons,tea towels etc.Screen printing is also undertaken for tee shirts and sweat shirts.Their products are sold in the shop and at craft shops,galleries, agricultural shows garden parties, and even West End stores.
